Updating your LinkedIn profile with your new name is a crucial step in maintaining your professional online presence. Here's a step-by-step guide to help you update your LinkedIn profile:

**Before you start:**

1. **Log in to your LinkedIn account:** Make sure you're logged in to your LinkedIn account using your current username and password.
2. **Prepare your new name:** Have your new name ready, including your first and last name, as you'll need to enter it accurately.

**Updating your LinkedIn profile:**

1. **Click on your profile picture:** In the top right corner of the LinkedIn homepage, click on your profile picture or initials.
2. **Select "Edit public profile & URL":** From the dropdown menu, select "Edit public profile & URL."
3. **Click on "Edit" next to your name:** On your profile page, click on the "Edit" button next to your current name.
4. **Enter your new name:** Enter your new first and last name in the required fields. Make sure to enter your full name accurately.
5. **Save changes:** Click the "Save" button to update your name.

**Updating your LinkedIn profile URL:**

1. **Click on "Edit public profile & URL":** Again, click on "Edit public profile & URL" from the dropdown menu.
2. **Click on "Edit" next to your URL:** Click on the "Edit" button next to your current LinkedIn profile URL.
3. **Enter your new URL:** Enter your new LinkedIn profile URL, which should include your new name. You can choose to keep your existing URL or create a new one.
4. **Save changes:** Click the "Save" button to update your LinkedIn profile URL.

**Additional steps:**

1. **Update your headline and summary:** Review your headline and summary to ensure they still accurately reflect your professional brand and experience.
2. **Update your work experience and education:** If your name change affects your work experience or education, update the relevant sections of your profile.
3. **Notify your connections:** Consider sending a LinkedIn message or posting an update to notify your connections about your name change.

**Tips and considerations:**

* **Username and login credentials:** Your username and login credentials (e.g., password) will remain the same unless you choose to update them.
* **Profile picture and background image:** You may want to update your profile picture and background image to reflect your new name and professional brand.
* **SEO and visibility:** Updating your LinkedIn profile with your new name may affect your search engine optimization (SEO) and visibility on the platform.
* **Consistency:** Ensure consistency across all your social media profiles and online presence by updating your name and profile information accordingly.

By following these steps, you'll be able to update your LinkedIn profile with your new name and maintain a professional online presence.
